H0.text: Competing is what two animals are when they live in the same area and depend on the same organism for food.

H1.text: Decomposing are two animals that live in the same area and depend on the same organism for food.

H2.text: Germinating is the condition that applies when two animals live in the same area and depend on the same organism for food.

H3.text: Hibernating is the term used when two animals live in the same area and depend on the same organism for food.

A4.text: Interspecific competition may occur when individuals of two separate species share a limiting resource in the same area.

A5.text: When species compete for a limited resource, one species eventually drives the populations of other species extinct.
